question.text: @PS@/kstoeic/images/4357513_1564545577574.png@PE@

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Q1 Hi, Aaron. How is the painting going? Q2 Have you finished most of the work on level two?
M: No, it is taking longer than we thought it would. We had to get some more paint delivered to the site so we just started working again.
W: OK. When you finish on level two, please come up to the fourth floor. We need your help to paint the ceiling. We don't have enough ladders. Q3 I suggest you bring at least three more ladders; there is a lot of work to be done here.
M: Sure. We just have one more coat to put here and then I will come up and help you finish.

question.text: Who most likely are the speakers?
Look at the graphic. Where is the man currently working?
What does the woman recommend to the man?
choices: (C) To  bring at least three ladders

answer.text: (C) To  bring at least three ladders

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Hi, Mark. This Is Julie in accounting. Q1 Our printer has broken down again and nobody in our department knows how to fix it. Could you stop by and give us a hand?
M: Q2 I wish I could help, but I have a meeting with an important client in half an hour. I have to be fully prepared when he arrives.
W: I understand. Q3 I’ll try to find an instruction manual. I hope it will help me figure out what exactly is wrong.
M All right. I’ll check on you right after the meeting.

question.text: What does the woman ask the man to do?
Why is the man unable to help?
choices: (A) He has to meet a major client soon.
(B) He finds the problem too complicated,
(C) He isn’t nearby at the moment.
(D) He doesn’t have the necessary tools.

answer.text: (A) He has to meet a major client soon.

question.text: What will the woman do next?
choices: (A) Attempt to solve the problem herself
(D) Have a meeting with a client

answer.text: (A) Attempt to solve the problem herself

question.text:
Harron Dry Cleaning

Fabric Price
Cotton $12
Denim $15
Cypress $20
Wool $25

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Good morning, I need this gown cleaned. Q1 I have to attend an award ceremony tomorrow night and I’ve only just noticed that there is a big stain on the back here. I need it cleaned by today. I know your service usually requires two days but this is an emergency... Can you help me?
M: Yes, I can have it ready for you by 9:00 P.M. It will cost $36.
W: Are you serious? Q2 But your price list says it should be $12.
M: Well, yes, but if you need an emergency service, we charge three times the price. I have to delay other people’s orders to clean yours so it causes me some problems.
W: OK. I understand. That’s fine. Q3 I’m busy this evening so I will send my intern to pick it up tonight at 9:00 P.M. Her name is Julie.
M: That sounds fine. I’ll have it cleaned by 9:00 P.M.

question.text: What does the woman say she will do tomorrow?
Look at the graphic. What is the gown made of?
What does the woman say she will do?
choices: (B) Send her husband to pick it up
(C) Send her intern to pick it up

answer.text: (C) Send her intern to pick it up

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Q1 Mr. Hawke, I just looked over our projected sales for this month and it looks like our current inventory of televisions won’t be enough to meet demand.
M: Do you think so? But I thought we increased our stock this month compared to last. How are we already running out?
W: Well, all of the advertisements we placed seem to be having the intended effect Q2 Thanks to the promotional sale this month, we are selling a lot more televisions than usual
M: Q3 OK, if anyone tries to buy a television that is out of stock, tell them that they can still get the same promotional deal next month as well.

question.text: What problem does the woman mention?
choices: (A) The advertisements are not widely circulated.
(C) The discounted price is not competitive
(D) The product is not selling well.

question.text: What does the woman say about this month’s sales figures?
choices: (B) They are similar to last month’s figures.

question.text: What does the man ask the woman to do?
choices: (A) Extend the length of the promotion
(B) Direct customers to the online store

answer.text: (A) Extend the length of the promotion

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
M: Ms. Simpson, can you tell me why you applied to work at our store? Q1 Judging from your resume, it appears you have no retail experience. What do you think makes you qualified for selling apparel?
W: You’re right. I previously worked as a secretary at a hospital. Q2 At that time, I learned that I really enjoy working with people. So I thought working in retail would be a good fit for me.
M: Yes, that is very important. Here at our store, we expect all employees to be kind and helpful with each and every customer. Q3 Next, I’d like to ask about your availability during the week.

question.text: Where most likely does the man work?
Why does the woman think she is qualified for the job?
choices: (B) She has worked similar jobs before.
(D) She majored in a related field.

question.text: What will the speakers discuss next?
@PS@/kstoeic/images/8638022_1564545579047.png@PE@

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: I apologize for being late Bruce. Q1 The Cranson Lot on Prunkel street was shut because of water damage from the recent hurricane, so I couldn’t find a parking spot.
M: That’s fine. Q1 Most of the staff is late today because of the Cranson Lot closure. Where did you park? Swinton Road?
W: Q2 There was a couple of spaces there but the sign said I couldn’t park there past 8:00 P.M. I think we will be working late tonight so I just parked on Menzies street.
M: Oh, that’s a smart move. I think Menzies street parking is 24 hours, Q3 so I suggest we have an early dinner and then get this project finished tonight.

question.text: According to the man, what is causing people to arrive late to work?
Look at the graphic. Where is the sign most likely located?
What does the man suggest they do?

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Hello, Mr. Penn. Q1 I wanted to ask about changing my work hours. I will be entering university starting next month and my availability is going to change.
M: Well, Naml, we really value you as a hard-working employee at this restaurant, so I want you to continue working here. What do you think your schedule will be?
W: Thank you for saying so. Q2 I haven’t registered for classes yet, so I’m not completely sure.
M: I see. Q3 Once you find out, please let me know. I’m sure we can figure something out so that you can attend university and continue working here.

question.text: What is the woman requesting?
Why is the woman unsure about the man’s question?
choices: (A) She wants to quit her job.
(B) She is waiting for her exam results.
(C) She got a job offer from another restaurant.
(D) She has not registered for classes.

answer.text: (D) She has not registered for classes.

question.text: What does the man ask the woman to do?

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Hello, this is Suzy Smith calling for Dan Harmon. I work at Danny Sweets. Q1 I’m calling to let you know that the wedding cake you ordered is ready to be picked up at any time.
M: Oh, thanks for calling. Q2 I’m extremely busy making other preparations for the wedding tomorrow and won’t have time to stop by. Can you deliver the cake instead?
W: I’m sorry, but we don’t offer any delivery service. Q3 However, if you give us a name in advance, you could have someone else pick it up for you.
M: Q3 OK, I’ll try to find someone to do that for me. I’ll call back later.

question.text: Where most likely does the woman work?
Why is the man unable to visit the woman’s workplace?
choices: (A) He has urgent arrangements to make.
(B) He must attend a wedding today.
(D) He has to prepare an order.

answer.text: (A) He has urgent arrangements to make.

question.text: What information will the man probably provide?

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
M: Hello, my name is Jordan Briggs. Q1 I’ll be getting married next week and we are looking for someone to photograph our wedding. A friend of mine showed me photographs you took and I was really impressed.
W: Thanks for calling me, Mr. Briggs. What type of photographs are you interested in exactly?
M: Well, we would want you to take photographs of everything including the guests, the food, the ceremony, and the after-party. Q2 How much would that cost?
W: Well, it could be quite expensive. Q3 In order to photograph the event that extensively, I would need to hire two or three assistants.

question.text: Why is the man calling?
What does the man inquire about?
Why does the woman say the service might be quite expensive?
choices: (A) Her services are in high demand.
(D) She has to meet a tight deadline

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: I have noticed that a lot of our customers are from all over the world. Q1 I think it’s because we provide exotic and delicious food, and we are near very popular tourist attractions.
M: You’re right. I have noticed that too. Q2 I was thinking maybe it would be very helpful if some of our servers could speak other languages fluently. That would make things much more comfortable for our customers.
W: Q3 Actually, I have already scheduled two interviews next week with potential employees. I’m going to interview a woman who can speak Japanese and a man who can speak Spanish.
